newsitem.title: UK: UK's North Petro, Malaysia Mining sign deal.
newsitem.headline: UK's North Petro, Malaysia Mining sign deal.

text.p: Britain's Northern Petroleum said on Monday it had agreed with Malaysia Mining Corporation Berhad to form a joint venture which will invest in proven reserves in the former Soviet Union and in the Middle East.
Northern said the investments would be structured in such a way that it could earn a "meaningful working interest" in much larger projects than previously envisaged.

Malaysian Mining will build up a 48 percent shareholding in Northern in two stages. Initially it will subscribe to 7.10 million shares at 29 pence each representing 28 percent of the enlarged share capital of Northern.

After completion, Northern will grant the option to Malaysian Mining to subscribe for a further tranche of shares up to a limit of 48 percent of the issued share capital of the company at the same price.
Several projects are currently under joint evaluation and negotiation by Northern and Malaysia Mining. This deal will increase the Malaysian firm's investments directly into Northern.
"The board considers that his strategic alliance with Malaysia Mining will add significant value to Northern's existing shareholders," Northern's chairman Peter Kingston said.
